publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2883 Bruce Crawford: Nuclear Power Stations-That the Parliament notes that consent for nuclear and other electricity power stations over 50 megawatts, under section 36 of the Electricity Act 1989, is a responsibility devolved to Scottish Executive Ministers and believes that the final decision over consent for nuclear power stations, now and in the future, must remain with Scottish Executive Ministers accountable to the Parliament. Supported by: Michael Russell*, Alex Neil*, Mr John Swinney*
S1M-2883 Nuclear Power Stations (lodged on 12 March 2002) Ms Sandra White*, Tommy Sheridan*
